Picturing the soignée Ahrendts surrounded by geeks in jeans and hoodies  we might be forgiven for wondering why Apple feels in need of a fashionista buff-up. column4: Morgan Stanley trims Q3 commodity trading risk
column5: Oct 18 Morgan Stanley trimmed its commodity trading risk in the third quarter from the previous quarter  the bank reported on Friday  but held its position as the Wall Street firm with the most money at play in the sector.     Value-at-Risk (VaR) in commodities stood at $20 million in the third quarter  down from $24 million in the second quarter and unchanged from the third quarter of 2012. That compares with $17 million for Goldman Sachs  and $13 million for JPMorgan Chase & Co.

column4: U.S. nuclear arms modernization plan misguided: scientists' group
column5: WASHINGTON An Obama administration plan to spend $60 billion over the next 25 years to modernize the U.S. nuclear arsenal is misguided and violates the spirit of its pledge not to develop new nuclear arms  a Union of Concerned Scientists report said on Thursday.

column4: NRG to buy Edison Mission Energy assets for $2.64 billion
column5: LOS ANGELES Power company NRG Energy Inc  said on Friday it would pay $2.64 billion to acquire the assets of bankrupt unregulated power producer Edison Mission Energy  adding nearly 8 000 megawatts of coal  gas and wind generation to its business.

column5: WASHINGTON Prudential Financial  said it will not ask a federal court to overturn a designation by the U.S. risk council that will subject the company to strict capital requirements and oversight by the Federal Reserve.

column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 18 Prudential Financial  said it will not seek court review of a decision made earlier this year by the U.S. risk council to designate the insurance giant as "systemically important " a tag that will subject Prudential to capital requirements and stricter federal oversight.

column4: More liquidity and China growth helps boost European shares
column5: LONDON  Oct 18 European shares rose on Friday on the back of robust growth data from China boosted luxury goods and mining stocks and expectations the Federal Reserve will keep monetary stimulus in the United States unchanged for months.

column4: UK's Osborne says actively considering RBS "bad bank": paper
column5: LONDON British finance minister George Osborne said his ministry was actively looking at breaking up the state-backed Royal Bank of Scotland  to create a "bad bank" to house its problem loans  the Daily Telegraph newspaper reported on Friday.

column4: UK's Osborne says actively considering RBS "bad bank"-paper
column5: LONDON  Oct 18 British finance minister George Osborne said his ministry was actively looking at breaking up the state-backed Royal Bank of Scotland to create a "bad bank" to house its problem loans  the Daily Telegraph newspaper reported on Friday.

column4: RBS chief says bad bank review a distraction
column5: LONDON Royal Bank of Scotland's (RBS)  new Chief Executive Ross McEwan said a government review into whether the bank should be broken up is distracting executives looking to revive the fortunes of the state-backed lender.

column4: UPDATE 3-RBS chief says bad bank review a distraction
column5: * RBS takes responsibility for resolving breakup debate-CEO

column4: RBS CEO urges customer focus as break-up verdict looms
column5: LONDON Royal Bank of Scotland's  Chief Executive Ross McEwan has urged staff to focus on customers in the face of uncertainty over whether Britain's finance ministry will order a break-up of the state-backed lender.

column4: Schlumberger  Baker top estimates with global drilling
column5: Increased oilfield activity in U.S. offshore waters and overseas gave a bigger-than-expected lift to profits at Schlumberger Ltd  and Baker Hughes Inc   marking a clear divide with struggling smaller U.S. oil services firms.

column4: WRAPUP 2-Schlumberger  Baker top estimates with global drilling
column5: Oct 18 Increased oilfield activity in U.S. offshore waters and overseas gave a bigger-than-expected lift to profits at Schlumberger Ltd and Baker Hughes Inc   marking a clear divide with struggling smaller U.S. oil services firms.

column4: Schlumberger profit rises on strong drilling worldwide
column5: Schlumberger Ltd   the world's largest oilfield services company  reported a better-than-expected 20 percent rise in quarterly profit as offshore drilling increased in North America and demand from the Middle East and Asia rose.

column4: UPDATE 1-Schlumberger profit rises on strong drilling worldwide
column5: Oct 18 Schlumberger Ltd  the world's largest oilfield services company  reported a better-than-expected 20 percent rise in quarterly profit as offshore drilling increased in North America and demand from the Middle East and Asia rose.

column4: UPDATE 1-Baker Hughes profit up on strong international drilling
column5: Oct 18 Baker Hughes Inc  the world's third-largest oilfield services company  reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit  driven by strong drilling activity in the Middle East and Asia Pacific.

column4: Schlumberger profit rises 20 pct as global drilling booms
column5: Oct 18 Schlumberger Ltd  the world's largest oilfield services company  reported a 20 percent rise in quarterly profit as global drilling activity remained buoyant.

column4: Sun journalist charged over theft of MP's mobile
column5: LONDON  Oct 18 Sun journalist Nick Parker is to be charged with receiving an allegedly stolen mobile phone belonging to Labour MP Siobhain McDonagh  the Crown Prosecution Service (CPS) said on Friday.

column4: Taiwan stocks hit over 2-year closing high; TSMC jumps
column5: TAIPEI  Oct 18 Taiwan stocks rose 0.8 percent to a 26-month closing high on Friday  led by gains in TSMC  after the world's top contract chip maker posted better-than-expected quarterly earnings.      The main TAIEX index ended at 8 441.19  its highest closing level since August 2011.      TSMC jumped 3 percent  sending the electronics subindex  up 1.3 percent. column4: Cessna maker's profit falls as businesses delay spending
column5: Cessna maker Textron Inc's  profit fell 31 percent in the third quarter and the company warned on business jet deliveries in 2013 as small business owners delay spending.

column4: UPDATE 3-Cessna maker's profit falls as businesses delay spending
column5: * Income from cont ops $0.35/share vs $0.48 a year earlier

column4: Textron profit falls as Cessna sales hit air pocket
column5: Cessna maker Textron Inc  reported a 31 percent fall in quarterly profit from continuing operations due to sluggish sales of its jets as small business owners delay spending in an uncertain U.S. economy.

column4: Textron profit dives as Cessna aircraft sales fall
column5: Oct 18 Textron Inc  the world's largest maker of business aircraft  reported a 31 percent fall in quarterly profit from continuing operations due to sluggish sales of its Cessna aircraft.

column4: CFO quits Time Warner-backed east Europe broadcaster in new shake-up
column5: PRAGUE The chief financial officer of broadcaster Central European Media Enterprises is to quit  the latest departure at a loss-making group where major shareholder Time Warner has been strengthening its hold.

column4: Imperial says gas back at Kearl  working to restore operations
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Oct 18 Imperial Oil Ltd  said on Friday gas deliveries had resumed at its Kearl oil sands project in northern Alberta after a TransCanada Corp  pipeline break on Thursday.

column4: U.S. Steel to write down $1.8 bln in value of units
column5: Oct 18 United States Steel Corp said it expects to write down the value of two of its North American units by up to $1.8 billion  hurt by a prolonged slump in steel prices due to overcapacity and a weak global economy.

column4: Wal-Mart offers to rehire employee fired for aiding attacked woman
column5: A Michigan man who was fired by Wal-Mart after he defended a woman who was attacked in a store parking lot during his meal break has been offered his job back  the company said on Friday.

column4: Wal-Mart offers to rehire employee fired for aiding attacked woman
column5: Oct 18 A Michigan man who was fired by Wal-Mart after he defended a woman who was attacked in a store parking lot during his meal break has been offered his job back  the company said on Friday.

column4: India probe into Wal-Mart investment moves to central bank: sources
column5: MUMBAI/NEW DELHI An investigation by Indian authorities into whether Wal-Mart Stores Inc violated local investment rules in 2010 has been referred to the country's central bank  officials familiar with the matter said.

column4: UPDATE 2-TransCanada says 2 Alberta customers lack gas after line break
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Oct 18 Two of TransCanada Corp's natural gas customers in northern Alberta were without deliveries on Friday  a day after a pipeline break forced some of the biggest producers in the Canadian oil sands to cut back their output.
